body:
I think there is no much alternative besides doing an `if` like you did...

You can make it more readable, though:

```yaml
test "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" = "linux" -a -n "$TRAVIS_TAG" && blah
```

It can be indeed a good idea to add it to the README...

I've got a machine somewhere doing builds and releases for a project. The machine listens to CI builds (via callback mechanism) and, when all expected builds have completed, releases.

You could do that.

Outside of that there's nothing in the travis docs that suggests a better way.
How about a separate release branch?

> How about a separate release branch?

what do you mean?

Set the Travis config to release the build on a specific branch other than master. This branch will be used only for releases.
```sh
 if [ "$TRAVIS_BRANCH" == "release" ]; then ...
```
Not sure how this can be wired to be executed at the end of the other tests, but it can limit the release to a single build.
But the problem here seems to be the OS matrix, I don't see how having a branch for releases would help in that case...
Sorry, I thought this was about limiting deployment to a single build rather than doing the same release to all OS :)

issue.title: Mention single run for CI
issue.body: We cannot include code here since there are too many different scenarios. A note has to be enough. Closes #92.

issue.title: Snap packages with multiple apps use the wrong binaries
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

When building snap packages with multiple builds, there is a bug where the application names are being overwritten.

Context: https://github.com/TheThingsNetwork/lorawan-stack/issues/2351

**To Reproduce**

Relevant part of the .goreleaser.yaml file below.

```yaml
builds:
  - id: stack
    main: ./cmd/ttn-lw-stack
    binary: ttn-lw-stack
  - id: cli
    main: ./cmd/ttn-lw-cli
    binary: ttn-lw-cli
snapcrafts:
  - id: stack
    builds:
      - cli
      - stack
    apps:
      ttn-lw-stack:
        plugs: [ home, network, network-bind ]
      ttn-lw-cli:
        plugs: [ home, network, network-bind ]
```

> Make sure your config file is valid by running
> `goreleaser check -f path-to-config-file`.

**Expected behavior**

`ttn-lw-stack` should execute the binary `ttn-lw-stack`.
`ttn-lw-stack.ttn-lw-cli` should execute the binary `ttn-lw-cli`. 

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- OS: ubuntu
- OS version: Linux matrix 4.15.0-91-generic #92-Ubuntu SMP Fri Feb 28 11:09:48 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- GoReleaser Version: dev (running from latest master)
- GitLab version (if using a private hosted one)

**Additional context**

See https://github.com/TheThingsNetwork/lorawan-stack/issues/2351#issuecomment-614949533 

Tested with `v0.124.1` and the bug is not present, so I would assume that the bug was introduced with this commit: https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/commit/eb528971b9da279084886d2dba5f47bbd6df8fdd

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
